alert.note: Alert for Boulder (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 06 at 6:10PM MDT until July 06 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTH CENTRAL BOULDER COUNTY... At 610 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated continued light rain showers ongoing. Up to 0.4 inches of rain has fallen over the western and southwest portions of the burn area. Local law enforcement did not report any flash flooding at this time. However more rain is expected in the burn area this evening with another quarter of an inch possible. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of North Central Boulder County FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-0.75 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Heavy rainfall will cause flash flooding of creeks, streams, and ditches in the Calwood burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected. The main areas of concern are Heil Valley Ranch and Lefthand Creek just above US 36.
